inn1.comm: signs of a sightly sluggish pitch. Short of a length at 125 kph, he tries to pull it away but it keeps lower and is bottom edged onto the pad.
another bottom edge. Hint of swing for Shafiul from very wide of off stump. Hafeez reaches across to cut, but the ball doesn't come on and he chops it down.
middles the ball now, stays on the crease and punches firmly to wide mid-off.

typical slow-pitch dismissal. Hafeez is gone to a soft shot. Short, wide, and painfully sluggish. The ball rises in slow motion, and Hafeez is already through his punch into the covers when it comes through. He lobs it amiably into the covers off the bat toe, and makes his way back. Bangladesh are thrilled.
short of a length outside off, Younis plays a trademark steer from beside the line. Can't elude backward point though.
maiden to start off. Shafiul shapes it away from back of a length outside off and Younis lets it go.
fuller length outside off and moving away, Shafiq meets it off the front foot and plays it into the covers.
good lengths. Very good lengths. Shafiq stays cautiously behind the line, he can't drive or stay back to these, and defends.
and again in the channel. Shafiq gets the front foot across and defends to the off side.
this one angles into the pads, Shafiq turns it around the corner gingerly. Ten balls gone, and no runs.
good stop from Sunny at short cover, he tumbles away to the left to stop a laboured drive. Back of a length and the ball stops on Shafiq as he tries to force it into the off side.
another maiden! Reza delivers full and brisk on off stump, Shafiq stays defensive.
Younis stays on the crease and steers away from his body towards point.

huge appeal for lbw but it is turned down. Inside edge saves Younis. Shafiul swings this in at decent pace - mid 130s that - and Younis leans out to drive, and managed to get a thin feather onto the pad.
still no runs! Younis stays put on the crease and attempts yet another back foot dab, that doesn't beat point.

tigerish from the, well, Tigers! Reza pounces away in the covers now and makes a half-stop, but Younis is away with a single after pushing from the crease. Reza did really well there, but is angry at having conceded the single.
short of driving length to Shafiq who is compulsively forward as he feels for it and defends.

uppish but safe. Expect a lot of those today. It was pitched up, but wasn't exactly a half-volley. A yard or so fuller than the ball that consumed Hafeez, and Shafiq planted the front foot across and smote it through the line. It stopped on him, but there was no stopping his bat swing. Clean and crisp over the covers.
length ball angles into Younis' pads and he punches solidly to mid-off.
keeps Younis in the crease with a whippy length ball that doesn't rise. Younis defends back down the track.
Younis covers the line and defends a delivery that darted in with the angle.
on the pads now, Younis nudges it with the angle through square leg for a single. Not the first time Reza has bent one too far in, but this has been an impressive start all the same.

An appeal for run out at the bowler's end goes to the third umpire. It was pitched up to Younis, who drove it back fluently. Reza tried to stop it with the boot, and might have got a touch on it, but Shafiq was alert at the bowler's end. The bat goes back in before the ball crashes into the stumps, and he is safe.
back of a length on middle stump, Younis stays back and forces it to mid-on.
short of a length at 131 kph, Shafiq pushes back into the crease and defends towards point.
short ball angles into Shafiq who carefully works it wide of mid-on for a single.
timing is proving close to impossible on this pitch. Younis is among the best in the game, but he can barely force this back foot punch off the square as Shafiul keeps it short of a length.

It's all happening at the ZACS! No-ball, edge, doesn't carry to the keeper, runs away for four, and a free-hit to follow. Shafiul changes the angle, goes very wide and has in fact cut the return crease. Younis goes at it hard-handed, away from the body and gets a healthy edge, but it drops well short of slip on this pitch. He parries it away and it runs through to the third man fence.
Younis can't get it away. Full and very wide of off stump, close to being called in fact. Younis opened up the stance and looked to blaze it straight down the ground, but missed.
short of a length outside off, Younis opens the face to glide it behind point for a single.
clumsy from the Mighty Atom. Slow offcutter lands wide of off stump and rolls along, but Mushfiqur couldn't get behind it and let it run right through his legs to reach the boundary.
angled in from wide of the crease onto middle and leg, Younis works it towards square leg.
too straight to Shafiq, he dabs it with the angle straight to backward square leg.
finds midwicket with a whip shot now as Razzak again angles into the pads.
uppish but wide of the bowler. He slows it up and flights it outside off, Shafiq is early on the drive and nearly scoops it back.
Younis deftly angles the bat face to work a full ball backward of square leg for one.
the quick armer comes in sharply, Shafiq hurries back in the crease and looks to force it into the covers.
pitched up outside off, Younis still can't time the drive as he goes expansive into the covers. it goes straight to the cover fielder.
shorter length, but played to the same fielder with a similar lack of timing off the back foot now.

Shafiul stretches his luck too far. He drags this really short and gives Younis enough room to free his arms, and Younis doesn't need a second invitation. He opens up his stance and carves this over the covers for a boundary.

short again, and this time too straight. Younis says thank you. This is not a pitch for the drives, but it does sit up nicely when dropped short. Younis had aeons to rock back and drag the pull between mid-on and midwicket.
the pressure is on Shafiul now. Wide down the leg side.
Younis hangs back in the crease and produces a bread and butter single through backward point.
finishes the over with a full length ball on off stump, Shafiq leans forward to defend resolutely.
Razzak darts one down the leg now, and Younis helps it along to fine leg for a couple.
too short and wide enough for Younis to make room and steer through backward point. Pakistan are methodically breaking the shackles here.
tossed up with a hint of drift, Younis leans out and defends with bat and pad close together.
tossed up to Younis, who reaches the pitch and drives through mid-off for one.
Shafiq remains careful, stays behind the line and defends.

ooh, Ramiz Raja nearly put the commentators' curse on Shafiq there. The arm ball nearly sneaks through a lazy forward push with bat and pad not close together, but he gets an inside edge that runs past leg stump.
tossed up outside off, Shafiq defends with soft hands into the off side.

big spin and a stumping appeal goes upstairs. Classic stuff from Shakib, this. He tosses it up invitingly outside off, it curves in and breaks it away. Shafiq is lured into the trap, he goes for the drive and drags his back foot out of the crease. The ball spins past the edge and goes into Rahim's gloves. He seemed to take an extra moment to gather and break the stumps. Shafiq had the chance to push the toe back in, but he might be on the line... The umpire's taking a close look at this. It's a matter of millimetres. Probably microns. He gets the benefit of doubt.
Shafiq stays in the crease this time as Shafiq angles one in and gets it to straighten. Defended down the pitch.
similar ball, defended to the leg side from the crease.

lovely, lovely bowling! Shafiq is gone, there's no benefit of doubt to be had when the stumps are broken. He's set him up with a series of balls that spun sharply, and now sends down the armer from slightly wide of the crease. Shafiq is lulled into a loose drive off the front foot. The ball drops in front of him and shoots straight through bat-pad gap. All over.
tossed up outside off, that copyrighted front foot defence - assuring or mind-numbing, beautiful or ugly, depending on your affiliation.
pitched up to Younis, who drives without intent into the covers.
leans well forward this time to defend a full ball to the off side.
Younis gets down the track and looks to drive into the off side, but can't quite reach the flight and plays it to short cover.
gets the single away now, through mid-off with the drive.
armer to Misbah, who is forward with bat and pad close together. Inside edge onto the pad.
again, that trademark two metre forward lunge and defend routine. No one does it as comprehensively as Misbah.
tossed up on leg, Younis can't middle the straight drive and it dribbles past the bowler.
full pitched on off stump, Younis defends with the turn into the off side.
beaten by a rippa! Shakib gets the ball to talk in Bangla! This angles in towards leg and spins across Younis' proud bat face. It misses the outside edge, and sizzles past the stumps.
leans out and check-drives to mid-off with the turn.
stays in the crease and defends one that straightens from leg.
gets the single away with a drive through mid-off.

edged and straightforward catch! Younis may not want to see that replay, tossed up outside off and tempting the big drive through the covers, he bends his knee and drives a bit far from the body, the edge was loud and clear
flatter on the stumps and defended back to the bowler
gives him width and he reaches out to cut, ends up chopping it down to point
stays back and clips it to midwicket
keeps low and he stays at the crease and chops it down to cover
worked away towards short fine leg
gets forward and pushes it through the line to long-off
stays back, waits for it to turn and then clips it towards short fine leg
comes down the track and checks his shot, Shakib fumbles and the ball rolls behind him, he had to complete the run fast, the throw from mid-off was just wide of the stumps at the bowler's end
comes well forward and defends
gets forward and smothers the spin
speared into the pads, Umar dabs it to the leg side from the crease.
another drifting arm ball, Umar looks to cut against the turn. Not advisable on this pitch.

that's one brainfade out of the way. Umar survives. Tossed up on the stumps, and he look to smash it to leg side, and he misses. The ball misses the bottom edge, and the stumps to run down to fine leg, as the keeper misses out.
pushes it down towards cover
gets forward and pushes it to midwicket
I can't believe what I just saw! Misbah tries a big hit and misses. Fired in flat, it stays low, and slips past the slog-heave. Mushfiqur is helping Pakistan's scoring here. 12 byes conceded!
stays low outside off, Misbah stays back and defends to the off side carefully.
this one hurries in with the arm. Misbah was looking to play it into the covers, and then arrested his shot and defended with an open face.
stays carefully behind the line and defends again.
angled into the pads, Misbah hangs back and nurdles it with the angle through square leg.

Shakib does a good Shane Warne impersonation as he gets the ball to angle in and dart away drastically from outside off. Umar is sucked into a fat prod, but no cookie this time. It spins past the edge and Rahim collects this time.
another armer, another lbw appeal. Misbah defends with bat and pad close together and he got an inside edge.
very watchful from Misbah, leans out and defends watchfully to the off side.
quicker and flatter, Misbah doesn't cut it as much as hack it into the covers. Only a single to be had.
Umar skips out belligerently, but is miles short of reaching the flight and wisely chooses to defend.
fuller length, Umar is behind the line and defends to the leg side.
arm ball drifts in towards middle and leg to end the over, Umar works it with the angle to square leg for one.
sharp spin away from outside off, it takes Misbah's outside edge as he looks to defend with hard hands.
tossed up on the stumps, Misbah laces it through mid-off for a single.
Umar defends languidly as Shakib goes full outside off.
tossed up outside off, he drives it through mid-off for one.
Umar drives with the turn to long-off.
Misbah's turn to punch a single down the ground.
stays back and works a short ball to the leg side with the angle.
armer and a huge lbw appeal. Misbah was trapped on the crease as this shot through, but it was surely missing leg.
slightly wide of off stump, Misbah doesn't look to smash it and guides it into the covers.
another short and wide ball escapes. Misbah steers watchfully into the covers.
on the stumps now, Misbah gets everything behind it and defends.
Mushfiq is thrilled the moment he actually pouches one, he goes up in appeal. But no edge on this as Misbah misses the glance. Might have gone off the pad.
flighted on off stump, Umar defends off the front foot.
Umar is well forward again as he smothers a flighted ball.
speared in from wide of the crease, fuller than before, and Umar works it back to the bowler.
another dream ball from Shakib! Umar is left groping down the wrong line as it angles in from miles wide of the crease and straightens.
Umar can breathe easy at the other end after pushing a single down the ground.
Misbah stays back to a short ball and forces it down to long-on for one more. Drinks break, and Pakistan surely need one.
over-pitched on the stumps, Misbah punches to long-on for a single.
tossed up, invites Umar to drive and he prances out to push it through mid-off for one.
Misbah defends with that spirit-killing forward press of his.
on the pads, Misbah turns it through square leg for one.
tossed up on the stumps, Umar gets nicely forward for another single through mid-off.
Sunny will want to bowl slightly shorter. Another half-volley gives Misbah an easy single down the ground.
tossed up on the stumps by Shakib, Misbah's forward defensive nearly makes the ball evaporate into thin air. Almost.
stays back to a flatter ball that stays low and defends down the ground.
loopy ball outside off, Misbah is comprehensively forward to defend.
flatter ball this time, Misbah goes back and nudges to the leg side.
stays back again and forces a short ball to mid-on. Another maiden.
angled into the pads, Umar nudges it with the direction to short fine leg.
slow spin away from the right hander, Umar defends to point.
Umar skates out of the crease, takes the ball on the full and drills it to long-off for one.
hmm, Misbah goes for a bone-crunching slog over midwicket once mid-on came up, but he doesn't connect. He inner edges it onto his pad.
stays back in the crease and defends a length ball into the off side.
gets forward to near the pitch and defend a full ball down the track.
tweaked up on leg stump, and Umar works a single into the leg side.
not much spin, hurries through from back of a length and Misbah defends down the track.
over-pitched outside leg, Misbah flicks it straight to mid-on, who fumbles but doesn't concede a single.
stays back to the flat ball and defends it to the on side of the pitch.
fuller length, he leans out and works it back down the track.
over-pitched on middle and leg, Misbah whips it through midwicket and gets a single.

mishit, but good enough to clear mid-on. Misbah was trying this in the last over too. First four in 99 balls as he leans forward and tees off down the ground. The bat face turns and he drags it to the leg side, but gets it over wide mid-on.
here comes the Misbah reverse-sweep, but it doesn't beat short third man.

Sunny smiles in resignation. Misfield at midwicket allows the second four in three balls. They are like London buses today. Tossed up and clipped cleanly off the pads, but Kapali should have stopped that.
full length on off stump, Misbah defends it back to the bowler.

murderous Misbah! Lulls the fielding team into thinking he is in tuk tuk mode and then bashes a series of boundaries. He backs away to the leg side, showing Sunny all his stumps, and the ball is delivered on a length on middle and leg. Misbah stands still and clubs it right back past Sunny.
end of an expensive over as Misbah leans out and defends a full ball back to Sunny.
Umar tries a Misbah impersonation, but can't get enough under the slog sweep as Kapali pitches it up.
straight delivery, he's putting a lot of rotation on the ball without spinning it. Umar dabs to the leg side for a single.
fuller length, Misbah comes forward to dead bat.
again, Misbah gets the half-trot forward and defends.
flat ball outside off, pushed down to long-on for one.
tossed up on the stumps, worked with the wrists through mid-on for one more.
pitched up on the stumps, defended off the front foot.
looks to blast Sunny with the turn through the covers and nearly succeeds, but doesn't find the gap.
grip and turn, that stopped on Umar who coverd the line and defended.
gets the single now, worked with the turn towards cover.

hilarious stuff! Mushfiqur jumps to the off side as Misbah gets ready for a reverse sweep, but he gets the shot away low enough to once again find that safe gap - between Rahim's legs - as the keeper tumbles haplessly. Good anticipation, but not good enough.
defends a full ball to the leg side.
back of a length on the stumps, Misbah works it to the leg side defensively.
full toss on the pads, asking to be exploited. Misbah whips it to deep midwicket for two. These two have added 50.
flatter ball, Misbah stays back in the crease to defend down the pitch.

Misbah backs away to the leg side again, and scrambles Kapali's lines completely. He ends up trying to following him, and ends up going too far. Misbah is inside the line and nurdles it along to fine leg for four.
tossed up on off stump, Misbah drives laboriously to mid-off
tossed up again, Misbah drives through wide mid-on for a single.
leading edge as Misbah looks to work it square and ends up popping it towards cover.
angled down the leg side now for a wide. The pressure is coming off.
Misbah again goes well outside leg before walking back into a saner position, and defends to the off side.
tossed up on the stumps, Misbah drives through mid-on for one.
Umar covers the line and defends a flat ball back to the bowler.
single now, Umar stays back and pushes through mid-off.
short of a length, Misbah stays back as it straightens down the line and defends.
turning into middle and leg, Umar drives to mid-on for one.
very full on off, Misbah gets the front pad across and paddles it down to fine leg for a single.
too full to Umar now, and he chips it down the ground for the 100th run.
short of a length well wide of off, it doesn't stop Misbah from lapping it across behind square for a single.
angled in from wide of the stumps towards middle and leg, Umar defends to the off side.
whoa, a simple single to be had and Misbah doesn't respond. Umar works it between the bowler and midwicket, who both gave chase to get to the ball after it had crossed the circle.

stumps are down at the bowler's end, not for the first time today. Pitched up, full and straight and Misbah ram-rods it back down the track. The bowler can't get a finger on it and it crashes into the furniture.
short ball, he looks to cut but can't get it past point.
slow offcutter, cuts in towards the pads and Misbah nudges it to the leg side for a single. They think of a second, but Sunny releases quickly, though the throw is poor.
fullish length, Umar leans out to drive it back to the bowler.
back of a length and cutting in, Umar nudges it to the leg side.
too short to Umar, he transfers the weight back and pulls through midwicket for a couple.
flat ball on middle and leg, defended from the crease to the leg side.
Misbah dabs with the turn to the leg side for a single.
smasher! Umar leaps out, gets to the flight and carves audaciously, inside out over extra cover. What a lovely stroke! Saw Rohit Sharma play this yesterday, another precocious talent.
Umar gets the single now, pushing a length ball in front of square.
short ball to Misbah, lapped around the corner for one.
back of a length outside off, Misbah stays on the crease and forces it square.
back of a length on the stumps, Misbah pushes through mid-on for a single.

that was some interesting play-acting! Umar jumps out of the crease early, Shafiul sees him and drops it short and wide, and Umar chose to leave it in the end as it bounced sluggishly. Rahim got into a knot before stopping it too.
gets a single away off the hips towards midwicket.
back of a length on the pads, worked to the leg side from the crease.
Umar's looking the part now. Short ball from Shafiul, angling into the slot and sitting up pleasantly. Umar jumps back and across before lashing the pull away over midwicket.
Misbah is not going to be outdone by the young Turk. He moves to the leg side, confuses Sunny into giving him a full toss and tonks it mighty over wide long-on for a biggie.
does the back away and return routine once again, and ends up defending a full ball to the off side.
that spun, sharply away after angling in towards Misbah and took the outside edge as he looked to defend.
this is looking hilarious now. Misbah again walks away, and then strolls back into position before defending a tight delivery on middle and leg.
flighted outside off, worked into the point area with an open face.
short and stays low outside off, Umar mistimes the cut to point.
another short ball, it stays low once more, but Umar is ready and crouches low as he backs away, before carting it over midwicket for four more.
this is pretty poor bowling. Short and wide outside off, gets away with it as Umar cuts straight to backward point.
flighted on off stump, Umar is on the front foot and plays it back to the bowler.
loopy ball on middle and leg, worked with the angle to midwicket.
short ball outside off, Umar cuts but finds point.
Misbah leans out and opens the face to steer Sunny with the spin to cover-point. Misfield allows the single.
sharp spin away now, Umar is late to adjust and then defends to the off side as the ball breaks away.
gets a single past the diving Reza in the covers.
Misbah does the prance away and dance back into line routine before defending. You got to love this guy!
full ball on middle and leg, Misbah defends resolutely.
marginally outside off now, worked with the turn to point.
leg stump and flicked to deep square for one.
inside edged and no score
cut off the back foot to short extra cover.
poor stroke from Misbah. Wide full of length and he stretched for it and chipped it simply to Nasir at short-extra cover who claimed a simple catch.
defends his first ball back to the bowler
a double strike for Bangladesh. Drawing the batsman down the wicket, Shoaib didn't get to the pitch of the ball and popped up a catch to the bowler's left. Pouched easily and two down in the over.
defended into the leg side
blocked back up the pitch, hint of turn
defended into the offside
full of length and driven down the ground for one.
and he's away first ball, angling a length ball past slip for two as it runs away towards third man.
strikes the pad, no run
playing forward and pushed into the offside for none
turned away through square leg after a brief cry for leg before from the bowler, can't think why
Afridi drives off an inside edge back to the bowler
and then looks to drive off the back foot, only inside edging into his own pad.
but here he goes, opening up the offside and lifting a length ball over the covers for four.
and drives down the ground for an easy single.
Afridi follows with a straight push for a single
and another milked run down the ground.
Afridi opens the face and takes another run behind square on the off side.
Akmal defends coming forward on leg stump
and blocks again to end a sensible over.
Afridi sweeps and misses, cry for leg before but it's going down as they take a leg bye
single down the ground to long on
Afridi is back and punching to long-on for another run.
pitched up and driven but a good diving save by Alok at extra cover. Good work.
Akmal gets cramped trying to back foot drive ball runs into the leg side.
this time he makes contact but only as far as mid-wicket to end the over
Afridi goes big into the leg side but makes nowhere near enough contact. A straightforward chance to deep midwicket and easily taken.
cut by Akmal to deep point
kept low, Rehman played back and did well to keep it out with the toe of the bat
turned to square leg.
turns into the batsman who goes to move it round the corner but misses out.
plays forward and another good over for the hosts concludes.
cut away by Akmal and it's good running and they stride back for the second
defended from off stump.
great shot. Excellent use of the crease, not that short but pulled hard wide of mid on for four
and this one is gone way back into the seats. Huge heave over long on
now pushed through cover point for a single.
Rehman defends and the over ends.
Akmal gets a bit too keen having gone past 50. Down the track to Sunny, in no position to play an attempted lofted drive. He misses, the keeper whips the bails off and Pakistan lose another.
left handers don't like the left arm spin of sunny. turning into the new man Tanvir he defends awkwardly
better defended
worked behind square to get Tanvir away
against the spin, worked down the ground for a single
flicked just wide enough of midwicket to allow them to scamper through for a run.
back foot drive to cover, well fielded.
pushed to point, they consider, and then quickly refuse, a single.
nudged up to extra cover.
nicely cut past point and a very welcome boundary for the Pakistanis.
again they consider a single into the offside but turned down, and rightly so.
this time Tanvir opens the face sufficiently to get it in the gap to deep cover.
a very sharp single to point who was just slightly asleep for me.
pushed down the ground
Tanvir goes to cut and it's a feather-edge through to the keeper. Rahim stays low and composed to complete a very good catch, he didn't have much time to react.

another one bites the dust! Mahmudullah is on a hat-trick, as is Rahim, and Pakistan are nine down. That one didn't turn in much as Gul prodded forward and felt for it, it just slid along and took the outside edge. Rahim's day is getting better and better. Mahmudullah is chuffed - no bowling for 44 overs, and then two scalps in four balls.
no hat-trick! Ajmal leans out laboriously and pushes a nervous single into the off side.
Rehman stays back and cuts a short ball through point for one more.
tossed up from over the stumps, driven against the spin into the covers for one.
speared in from wide of the stumps, Ajmal leans forward and defends to the off side.
on the pads as Ajmal leans out and works it to the leg side.
angled in, Ajmal pre-meditates the sweep and pre-meditates well. He got the front pad out of the way and broomed it down to fine leg for a couple.
back of a length and straightening, it meets a defiant straight bat.
again straightening down the line, Ajmal defends off the front foot.

all over! The umpire's finger went up in a hurry. Rehman looked completely plumb there. Mahmudullah has rolled out the tail in seven balls. He angled this in from round the stumps, and got it to straighten past the forward prod and thud into the pad low and in front of middle and off.

inn2.comm: Hafeez has again got Tamim for a duck! This is uncanny! Devon Smith will have his sympathies for Tamim. This one turned. It angled in, landed on off and straightened ever so slightly. Tamim was forward and solid in defence, but down the wrong line. The ball slipped past and hit off stump.
back of a length and spinning into the pads, defended cautiously to midwicket.
almost caught at short leg. That spun in sharply as Mahmudullah lunged out to defend, and took the inside edge. It died on short leg, but worrying signs for the hosts.
too much spin, it slips down the leg side and Afridi just stops it in front of the ropes.
tossed up and spinning in, Mahmudullah presses out to defend to the off side.
tossed up and spinning in, worked with the spin to mid-on.
seam movement away from the right hander. Short and wide, though, and it is an easy leave.
back of a length on the pads at 134 kph, Mahmudullah tucks it to the leg side from the crease.
sharp offcutter, jumps into Mahmudullah who takes a lazy forward step, and is struck on the hip. Ouch moment.
back of a length, Mahmudullah tries to steer square away from the body and can't get it away.

loose, very very loose. Full length outside off, and Mahmudullah throws his bat at it without moving the feet. It misses the outside edge, ever so closely. He's not used to batting at the top of the order ...
too straight to end the over, Mahmudullah turns it around through midwicket for a couple.
angled in from round the stumps onto Nafees' pads and he glances it down to fine leg for a couple.
Nafees is conscious of the men catching, and turns the bat face to the leg side as Hafeez tosses it up.
back of a length on middle and leg, Nafees tucks it square for a single.

Mahmudullah takes him on! Tossed up into the slogging area, and Mahmudullah gives it a fair bit of heft after going down on a knee. Mowed over midwicket, and the sort of shot that should push Pakistan onto the backfoot a touch.
full ball on the pads, Mahmudullah can't get the whip away.
forces a single down the ground to end the over.
hard hands from Mahmudullah yet again, he throws the bat at a short and pacy ball outside off, and the thick edge flies down to third man. A gully won't be a bad idea
short of a length outside off, Nafees stands tall and punches to mid-off.
keeps it short of a length outside off, and Nafees steers straight to point.
short of a length outside off, Nafees doesn't have the room as he looks to cut, but finds point.
short of a length again, Umar's not giving much to drive and Nafees forces into the off side again.
goes fuller finally, and Nafees digs it out to Misbah at short cover.
the first ball slides down the leg side for a wide.
tossed up outside off, driven off the front foot to mid-on.
straightens from middle stump, and Mahmudullah defends down the track.
tossed up on the stumps, driven off the front foot to mid-on.
very full, nearly yorks Mahmudullah who adjusts late and drills it through wide mid-on for one.
back of a length and slight spin away, Nafees covers the line and blocks.
draws him out with a deceptive fuller ball that hurries in after pitching, but Nafees gets behind the line.
short and flat outside off, Mahmudullah pushes it to the off side.
angled in on off, Mahmudullah defends with bat and pad not close together, and the inside edge pops through the vacant short leg area ...
short and wide outside off, Nasir cuts against the turn towards point.
straightens from middle and off, Mahmudullah covers the line and defends.
another inside edge, this time it bursts past leg slip and goes towards fine leg for one.
fired in full on the stumps, Nafees nurdles it to midwicket. He'll be back to bat in 40 minutes.
tossed up on the stumps, defended.
spinning down the leg side and it is called a wide.
another one slips down the leg and is called.
pushes a single down the ground and gets a single.
tossed up on off stump, and defended solidly.
straightening from middle and off, defended off the front foot.
goes a touch fuller, Mahmudullah leans out to defend back to the bowler.
whoa, that ball came to a complete stop as it bounced and Mahmudullah was stuck committed to the cut. He managed to back out, and works it square.
straighter, defended down the track.
sharp spin away, takes the outside edge as Mahmudullah feels for it. Tough times!
back of a length from round the stumps. Defended from the crease to the off side.
angled in towards middle and leg, worked cautiously to the leg side.
draws him forward with a very full ball and it is defended off the front foot.
again, that extra spin away from the left hander and Nafees guides it carefully to slip.
over-pitched on middle and leg, Nafees punches to mid-on. Another maiden.
spin away off stump, Mahmudullah defends to the off side.
width outside off, Mahmudullah looks to cut and finds point with a half-hearted shot.
pushes a single down the ground now.
sharp spin into the left hander, Nafees' front pad comes in the way, and there's a loud appeal...
works with the turn behind square on the leg side.
tossed up and Nafees goes for a big heave. He can't find the gap though.
first ball straightens and off an edge they take two to third man.
second ball pushed into the covers and they take a single
full and quick from Afridi and kept out well into the leg side.
cut away nicely. Races away past point and it always races away from Afridi's darts
Shahriar comes forward and pushes into the covers.
another attempted cut but this is missed, taken by the keeper and the over is complete.
good length, played off the back foot to cover.
Mahmudullah sweeps hard and heaves it over square leg for four, only heightening the pandemonium in the stands.
this time he covers up into the leg side.
tucked away, the fielder is now back on that square fence so an easy single available.
another sweep for four. This time a more conventional stroke from Shahriar. Excellent technique and the fourth boundary of the innings.
sharp turn into the batsman and it's beaten everything and raced away for four.
cut out to deep cover for a single.
tossed up and draws the batsman into the drive, only back to Afridi.
Shahriar sits back and cuts hard past point.
pushed down the ground for one.
grip and turn past the outside edge. Classic leg spin and much better from Afridi.
carefully pushed to point.
pushed to point from a good length
swept around the corner.
waits for the turn but can't get it far enough round the corner
carefully defended off the front foot
Ajmal goes straighter and strikes the pad
tucked to midwicket from Mahmudullah. Over.
nicely flicked down to long leg.
very poor line and tucked easily to the fine fence for four.
Goodness me. Mahmudullah takes two strides and lifts a ball from middle and leg over midwicket. Very nicely timed.
Better and defended off the back foot
with Tanvir around the wicket Mahmudullah uses the angle to defend wide of midwicket for a clever single
Tanvir doesn't adjust to the left hander and gets tucked to fine leg for another single
first ball back is pushed to the bowler
flicked into the off side
chipped in front of square off leg stump
tossed up outside off and Shahriar is forward driving to extra cover
now comes across to defend with bat and pad together
once again carefully defended
single taken into the leg side
defended forward
turned down to deep backward square. Decent scramble from the fielder to keep them down to one
again tucked through square, this time by the right-hander.
defended easily
angled to point, straight to the fielder
Ajmal round the wicket to Mahmudullah and beats him outside off as the batsman looks to cut
angled to the point fielder
straighter from Ajmal and turned to square leg this time
again across Mahmudullah and another play and miss from an attempted back foot drive
driven back to the bowler.
defended from off stump and that's another maiden for Ajmal.
Shahriar looks to flick to leg and gets hit on the pad
then tries to use his feet and blocks
then gets down on one knee and picks a length ball up beautifully down behind square for four
sensibly defended into the covers
cry for leg before as the batsman defends with bat and pad together. No chance.
the keeper jumps two strides to the leg side and then decided to appeal for leg before as Shahriar sweeps and misses. Again, think again sir...
and Bangladesh aren't going to try anything against him. Defended carefully
runs off the pad for a leg bye
defended by Shahriar to mid off
The sweep has been kind to Shahriar but he played down the wrong line there. Hit bang in front and the umpire is quickly up with the finger to hang Pakistan a way back.
Mushfiqur Rahim the new man pushes up to point
and defends the next to end a successful Ajmal over - he's threatened since we came back on.
full on the stumps, defended off the front foot.
Mahmudullah nudges with the angle to the leg side and picks up a single.

Horror stroke! Plumb in front. Bangladesh are spinning out of control. Angled in from wide of the crease, it lands on off and straightens. The ball deceived Rahim in flight, it was a touch fuller than he thought as he stayed back and shaped to paddle it away. The ball slipped past and hit him in front of off. Was that doing too much? Umpire Cloete is convinced, and it seemed a fair call. Trouble!
loopy and spinning in from wide of off stump. Defended off the front foot.
another sweep played from the front of the stumps, but Shakib gets bat on it and it runs away fine.
hurries a quicker one through outside off, Shakib goes back to cut but the ball skids along past the outside edge.
offbreak turns in from outside off stump, Mahmudullah defends assuredly.
gets the front foot across and works with the turn towards midwicket.
that one spun more than Mahmudullah expected, and he is struck on the front pad! He is well forward, and is just outside the line. That saves him.
he skips out now, but can't get to the flight as he thinks of a loft. Defence again.
stays in the crease and defends a full ball.

The Professor strikes again. Bangladesh are disintegrating against spin. Hafeez's varying degrees of spin to the fore again, he normally uses his lack of turn to get his wickets. Today, the ones that spin are doing the job. Mahmudullah was back in the crease, looking to defend a length ball outside off, but it spun in like a top on ecstasy to rap him plumb in front. That floodlight break seems to have knocked the daylights out of this chase.
Rehman angles into the pads, and Shakib works it behind square.
Shakib stays back and pushes down to mid-on.
edged, but he gets four for it. Rehman stays back to a sharp slider, and plays inside the line. The edge went very fine, and flew through to third man.
back of a length on the stumps, worked from the crease to square leg.
leans out to the spin and on-drives down the ground for a single.
tossed up on the stumps, he carefully plays it back to the bowler.
flat delivery from round the stumps at 85 kph, and it is pushed against the turn to long-off for one.
flat again to Nasir, he forces it down the ground for one.
tossed up, Shakib gets to the flight and drives through extra cover for one. That makes him the leading ODI run-getter for Bangladesh, going past the legendary Mohammad Ashraful.
leading edge. Nasir plays back and works across the line with hard hands - that is wrong on several counts. The edge goes towards point, but lands safe.
gets behind the line and defends with more assurance now.
stays back and turns the ball with the spin towards square leg.
tight line, just outside off, and Shakib steers it off the outer half towards point.
fuller ball, Shakib leans out to defend into the covers.
Shakib is late to get forward as Ajmal dips the ball at him, but adjusts to defend.
tossed up wide of off stump, Shakib drives on the up to cover.
that scooted along after landing on a length! And spun. Shakib did extremely well to keep it out.
short and wide, Shakib pounces on it and looks to cut, but misses. He is livid with himself as Ajmal completes yet another maiden.
tossed up on off stump, Nasir drives down to long-on for one.

Hafeez foxes Shakib and makes it look as simple as stealing candy from a child. Tossed up, slower through the air, it lands outside off and stops on Shakib who is early on the off drive. He pops it to the right of Hafeez who pouches with glee. He gets runs, and he gets wickets. When he doesn't get runs, he gets even more wickets. What a year Hafeez is having!
tossed up outside off, he leans out and defends.
again Hafeez gets one to spin in extra. Kapali didn't spot it and is hit on the pad, but that was doing too much.
reaches out to the flight and drives a single down to long-on.
looped up outside off and spinning in, Nasir covers the line well and works it square for one. End of another destructive spell from Hafeez.

and another. Spin and the slow wicket are backfiring spectacularly on Bangladesh here. Tossed up, comes on slowly as Nasir commits himself to the cover drive, and he doesn't check the shot. It lobs into the covers, and Misbah tumbles forward to take a good catch. 69 for 1 has become 83 for 6.
flighted outside off, driven through mid-off.

Kapali offers an uncertain defensive prod and the ball spins back from bat and has everyone excited. It didn't go close to the stumps, though. Aha, Pakistan reckon that was played onto the boot before Umar Akmal caught it. Replays are being looked at now, but it looks like it hit the turf at some point after brushing the boot. Green light comes on, that one is working.
short of a length and skidding outside off, Kapali stays back and chops it to point.
curve and spin from Rehman, defended off the outer half towards point and they run across for a quick single. Direct hit from point, but Reza is easily in.
tossed up on off stump, Reza defends off the front foot into the off side.
short ball outside off, the pull is forced through midwicket for one.
back of a length, Kapai goes back and defends.
fuller and fired in at 96 kph, Kapali is late getting forward to it, but the ball hits the inside edge and goes behind square for one.
first boundary since the Stone Age, or something like that. Afridi gives it too much width and pace, and Reza's outside edge beats slip and short third man to run away.
now a wide down the leg side. Afridi bowls so well on normal tracks, he seems over-eager to do well on this one, and has struggled in the process.
short of a length on off and middle, Reza nudges it square for a single.
flat and fast outside off, Kapali angles the face and tries to guide it square but can't get it past point.
fired in on the stumps, defended off the front foot to the leg side.
straightens this from middle and leg, Reza spots the line and defends down the track.
drifts down the leg side, and Reza sweeps it fine for a couple more.
fuller and straightening on middle and off, defended off the front foot.
suddenly Rehman sends down a big spinner that whooshes past the outside edge as Reza gropes in hope.
the armer to end the over, looking for the lbw as Reza plants the front foot forward, but he gets the inside edge first.
Afridi is taken through backward square leg for a single.
drifts a full ball onto leg stump, and it is pushed down to mid-on for a single.
drift again, defended off the front foot. Barring when Hafeez and Ajmal have bowled, batting hasn't looked impossible.
tossed up again, draws Kapali forward to drive it back to the bowler.
big spin away from the off stump, Kapali guides it between point and short third man - Hafeez and Tanvir - neither stops it and they get a single.
short ball at 96 kph, Reza clubs it past Afridi for two more. Pakistan won't mind breaking this stand in the bud ...
angled in and straightening from middle, and Kapali drives off the outside half of the blade into the covers.
bash! Reza advances straight down, making room for a clean swing of the bat. Rehman drops it short and Reza happily claps it back past the bowler for four.
drops short now, and it is nudged through the leg side for a single.
Kapali defends from the crease into the off side.
speared in full on the pads, and defended to the leg side cautiously.
that spun, sharp and drastic back into the right hander. Reza defends watchfully from the crease to the leg side.
slider outside off, Reza is lulled into the outside edge as he tries to cover the line, in vain, from the crease. Single taken towards point.
Akmal goes up in a big appeal for a catch, Malik is not so convinced, the umpire neither. Akmal is livid with Malik for not appealing! No edge by the looks of it, it slid past the outside edge.
Reza gets a single in front of square now.
tossed up on the stumps, worked solidly through mid-on for one.
loopy on middle and leg, played back to the bowler.
angled in towards the pads, worked square for a single.
full and straight on middle stump, worked with the angle to square leg.
short ball, there for the cut, but Reza can't beat point.
fullish on the pads, Reza whips straight to square leg.
gets behind the line and defends a good length ball back down the track.
leading edge on the on-drive and it goes to the off side of the pitch.
flat from Malik, nudged with the turn through square leg.
full ball on middle and leg, and it is played back to the bowler.
quicker ball outside of, slides through at 90 kph and Kapali guides it behind point for one.
tossed up, Reza skips out and flicks through midwicket with the spin.
straightens down the line from the middle and off line, and it is defended carefully off the front foot.
fuller and slower, Kapali covers the line and defends back to the bowler.
ah, I jinxed him. He doubles his damages for the day with a wide down the leg.
risky, but Kapali is through. Reza steers a full ball to Younis at point. Kapali wanted the single, Reza stopped mid-pitch and the throw should have gone to his end. It didn't
works a full ball with the spin to square leg.
tossed up on the toes, and Kapali drives through wide mid-on for one.
full length ball on off stump, Reza defends with a forward press.
there you go, the topspinner tossed up wide of off. Reza nearly bites as he looks to lash through the covers. The ball is too good for the edge.

Reza is gone, and he's unlucky. There was an inside edge there, that umpire Cloete missed. Ajmal follows up the topspinner with a sharp offbreak that lands on off and hurtles in. Reza was pinned on the crease and the bat came around late, but he still managed to edge it onto the pad. The umpire didn't notice it, and has sent him back.
he defends a length ball on middle and leg back to the bowler.
kapali skips out of the crease and drives down the track, but can't get it past Malik.
the straighter one outside off, guided off the outside edge towards backward point.
another topspinner, Kapali spots it late and works it off the outer half of the blade to the bowler.

the crowd is stunned. Kapali is gone and that should be the game. Tossed up invitingly on off stump, Kapali plants the front foot across and mows across the line. He got pretty good connection on it, but not enough to clear Shafiq who wasn't fully back on the square leg fence. He had to turn to his right and back to take the catch, and it popped out in the first attempt. But he kept his cool and lunged back to pluck the rebound, a foot or so in front of the ropes.
extra turn from middle and off, Sunny searches for the line and defends shakily to the off side.
straightening from outside off, defended off the front foot.
angled into Razzak's pads, and he nurdles it square for a single.
fired onto the pads, Sunny tries to work it square but can't get it away.
Sunny gets the single now, pushed through mid-off.
Razzak stays back to a quick offbreak that straightens, and can't work the flick away.
Razzak's turn to go for a slog-sweep, but he doesn't make clean connection.
short and big spin away, Sunny cuts it away to point.

cleaned him up! Sunny is squared up by grip and spin, and is left groping as the ball breaks past and disturbs spin. This dismissal complements the Tamim wicket at the start of the innings. Sums up Bangladesh's day. They have been squared, and quartered, by Pakistan's spin.
flighted on leg stump, No. 11 goes for a big heave and misses.
Shafiul gets the front foot forward and tries to defend down the line now.
that jumps up and turns in sharply, and goes off pad (and maybe bat) to the leg side. Akmal can't get there.

And then there were none. Shafiul looks to lash to the leg side as a length ball spins in sharply and breaks the stumps. Malik looks relieved, Misbah smiles like a Cheshire cat, and the crowd looks distraught. Pakistan have swept the series.
